page.description: Specify properties for storing the image. For example, if the bound field is a character field, specify the folder where the image filename should be stored.
page.important: This property only apply when the image in this field is set using the '[Image Capture for List-Detail View]' action in Action Javascript.

description.p: This property is ignored if the [upload target] is set to S3.

When images are uploaded to the Server, they are stored initially in a temporary session storage. Once the record is saved, a permanent file is created on the server. The *[ui:Upload Folder]* is where images are permanently stored once they have been uploaded to the server, and the current record is saved. The Upload Folder can be specified as:

item.name: An absolute folder with a drive letter

description.p: If you specify a relative folder, the folder is relative to the location of the component in the application webroot on the server.
Upload Folder Examples:

item.name: images\products
item.description: A relative folder path, relative to the webroot

item.name: [myimages]
item.description: An alias that defines the folder. Aliases are defined in your [Web Publishing Profile]. For example, you might define an alias called [myimages] that resolves to c:\myimages\productImages.

item.name: [PathAlias.ADB_Path]
item.description: An alias that defines the folder. [PathAlias.ADB_Path] defaults to the [location of the workspace directory] in the development environment.

item.name: [PathAlias.ADB_Path]\images
item.description: An alias with a folder path.

item.name: c:\images\products
item.description: An absolute folder path. The path is the location on the Server.

item.name: \\images\products
item.description: A UNC (Universal Naming Convention) folder name.

important.p: Uploading to a folder on the server is not supported on Alpha Cloud. Use S3 storage.

description.p: This property is ignored if the [upload target] is set to S3.

The *[ui:File exists action]* defines what should happen when a file is uploaded to the server with the same name as a file that already exists. You can either overwrite the existing file or rename the uploaded file.
This property is ignored if the [upload target] is set to S3.

Suppose you only want to only store part of the filename:

In this case, you will want to transform the filename before it is stored in the Image field. To transform the filename, you create a *[ui:Transformation Expression]*. The *[ui:Transformation Expression]* is an Xbasic expression that uses special placeholders.

item.name: <Filename>
item.description: The uploaded filename, including drive and path

item.name: <ShortFilename>
item.description: The uploaded filename without the drive and path

description.p: In the "bike.png" example, the placeholders resolve to the following values:

item.name: <Filename>
item.description: c:\images\products\bike.png

item.name: <ShortFilename>
item.description: bike.png

description.p: To store the filename as "products\bike.png", you would specify the following *[ui:Transformation Expression]*:
Here are some additional *[ui:Transformation Expression]* examples

item.name: filename_encode("<filename>")
item.description: Encode the filename to use an alias. If an alias called 'ProductImages' (c:\images\products) was defined, would resolve to [ProductImages]\bike.png

item.name: "<filename>"
item.description: Resolves to the uploaded filename (e.g. c:\images\products\bike.png)

item.name: "<ShortFilename>"
item.description: Resolves to the short filename (e.g. bike.png)

item.name: "<PhoneGapAjaxURL>"
item.description: Only meaningful in a Cordova mobile application. Resolves to URL used for Ajax callbacks

description.p: This property only applies when the image is uploaded to the application server and the Image Capture action's [Data capture mode] mode has been set to *[ui:filename]*. This property is ignored if the [upload target] is set to S3.

The *[ui:beforeUploadedFileSave Xbasic]* defines is an optional Xbasic function to call prior to saving the file on the server. The Xbasic function is passed an object called *[xb:e]* with the following variables:

item.name: *[xb:e.tmpl]*
item.description: The UX component definition.

item.name: *[xb:e.targetName]*
item.description: The suggested name to use for saving the file.

item.name: *[xb:e.targetFolder]*
item.description: The suggested folder where the file should be saved.

item.name: *[xb:e.listFieldName]*
item.description: The name of the List field where the uploaded image filename is saved.

item.name: *[xb:e.listName]*
item.description: The List name to which the uploaded image is bound.

item.name: *[xb:e.filenameOnDevice]*
item.description: The file name on the mobile device.

description.p: Your Xbasic function can set the following values in the *[xb:e]* object:

item.name: *[xb:e.newTargetName]*
item.description: The filename to use. Overrides *[xb:e.targetName]*.

item.name: *[xb:e.newTargetFolder]*
item.description: The folder where the image should be stored. Overrides *[xb:e.targetFolder]*.

The *[ui:afterUploadedFileSave Xbasic]* defines is an optional Xbasic function to call after the file has been uploaded and saved on the server. The Xbasic function is passed an object called *[xb:e]* with the following variables:

item.name: *[xb:e.tmpl]*
item.description: The UX component definition.

item.name: *[xb:e.filename]*
item.description: The filename used to save the uploaded file.
